question: Which prophet was told by God not to marry or have children as a sign to Israel?
explanation: God commanded Jeremiah not to marry or have children as a prophetic sign of coming judgment.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not take thee a wife, neither shalt thou have sons or daughters in this place.

question: Which prophet was commanded by God to marry an unfaithful woman as a symbol of Israel's unfaithfulness?
explanation: God told Hosea to marry Gomer, a prostitute, to illustrate Israel's spiritual adultery against God.

verses.kjv:
The beginning of the word of the LORD by Hosea. And the LORD said to Hosea, Go, take unto thee a wife of whoredoms and children of whoredoms: for the land hath committed great whoredom,
departing from the LORD.

question: Which prophet's bones brought a dead man back to life when the body touched them?
explanation: When a dead man was thrown into Elisha's tomb and touched his bones, the man came to life and stood up.

verses.kjv:
And it came to pass, as they were burying a man, that, behold, they spied a band
of men; and they cast the man into the sepulchre of Elisha: and when the man was let down, and touched the bones of Elisha, he revived, and stood up on his feet.

question: Which prophet had a vision of a plumb line?
explanation: God showed Amos a plumb line to illustrate that He was measuring Israel's righteousness.

verses.kjv:
Thus he shewed me: and, behold, the Lord stood upon a wall
made
 by a plumbline, with a plumbline in his hand.
And the LORD said unto me, Amos, what seest thou? And I said, A plumbline. Then said the Lord, Behold, I will set a plumbline in the midst of my people Israel: I will not again pass by them any more:

question: What did God command Hosea to name his daughter to symbolize Israel's condition?
explanation: God told Hosea to name his daughter Lo-Ruhamah, meaning 'not loved,' symbolizing God's rejection of Israel.

verses.kjv:
And she conceived again, and bare a daughter. And
God said unto him, Call her name Lo-ruhamah: for I will no more have mercy upon the house of Israel; but I will utterly take them away.

question: Which prophet's wife was called 'the prophetess'?
explanation: Isaiah went to the prophetess, and she conceived and gave birth to a son.

verses.kjv: And I went unto the prophetess; and she conceived, and bare a son. Then said the LORD to me, Call his name Maher-shalal-hash-baz.

question: Which prophet prophesied that Rachel would weep for her children?
explanation: A voice is heard in Ramah, Rachel weeping for her children and refusing to be comforted.

verses.kjv:
Thus saith the LORD; A voice was heard in Ramah, lamentation,
and bitter weeping; Rahel weeping for her children refused to be comforted for her children, because they
were not.

question: Which prophet was told to lie on his left side for 390 days?
explanation: God told Ezekiel to lie on his left side for 390 days to bear the sin of Israel.

verses.kjv: For I have laid upon thee the years of their iniquity, according to the number of the days, three hundred and ninety days: so shalt thou bear the iniquity of the house of Israel.

question: Which prophet was told he would not see death before seeing the Messiah?
explanation: It had been revealed to Simeon that he would not die before he had seen the Lord's Messiah.

verses.kjv: And it was revealed unto him by the Holy Ghost, that he should not see death, before he had seen the Lordâ€™s Christ.

question: Who prophesied while standing in a basket of summer fruit?
explanation: God showed Amos a basket of summer fruit as a sign that the end had come for Israel.

verses.kjv: Thus hath the Lord GOD shewed unto me: and behold a basket of summer fruit.

question: Which prophet witnessed the glory of the Lord departing from the temple?
explanation: Then the glory of the Lord departed from over the threshold of the temple.

verses.kjv: Then the glory of the LORD departed from off the threshold of the house, and stood over the cherubims.

question: Which prophet was commanded to buy a field while Jerusalem was under siege?
explanation: God told Jeremiah to buy the field in Anathoth as a sign that houses and fields would be bought again.

verses.kjv:
Behold, Hanameel the son of Shallum thine uncle shall come unto thee, saying, Buy thee my field that
is in Anathoth: for the right of redemption
is thine to buy
it.

question: Which prophet had a son named Maher-Shalal-Hash-Baz?
explanation: The prophetess gave birth to a son, and the Lord said to name him Maher-Shalal-Hash-Baz.

verses.kjv: And I went unto the prophetess; and she conceived, and bare a son. Then said the LORD to me, Call his name Maher-shalal-hash-baz.

question: Which prophet saw a vision of a lion, ox, man, and eagle?
explanation: Ezekiel saw four living creatures, each with four faces: man, lion, ox, and eagle.

verses.kjv: As for the likeness of their faces, they four had the face of a man, and the face of a lion, on the right side: and they four had the face of an ox on the left side; they four also had the face of an eagle.

question: Which prophet saw a vision of a man with a measuring line?
explanation: Then I looked up, and there before me was a man with a measuring line in his hand.

verses.kjv: I lifted up mine eyes again, and looked, and behold a man with a measuring line in his hand.

question: Which prophet saw a vision of a plumb line?
explanation: The Lord was standing by a wall with a plumb line in his hand, showing judgment against Israel.

verses.kjv:

made
 by a plumbline, with a plumbline in his hand.
And the LORD said unto me, Amos, what seest thou? And I said, A plumbline. Then said the Lord, Behold, I will set a plumbline in the midst of my people Israel: I will not again pass by them any more:

question: Which prophet was lowered into a muddy cistern?
explanation: They lowered Jeremiah by ropes into the cistern; it had no water in it, only mud, and Jeremiah sank down into the mud.

verses.kjv:
Then took they Jeremiah, and cast him into the dungeon of Malchiah the son of Hammelech, that
was in the court of the prison: and they let down Jeremiah with cords. And in the dungeon
there was no water, but mire: so Jeremiah sunk in the mire.

question: Which prophet was commanded to cook food over human dung?
explanation: Eat the food as you would a loaf of barley bread; bake it in the sight of the people, using human excrement for fuel.

verses.kjv:
And thou shalt eat it
as barley cakes, and thou shalt bake it with dung that cometh out of man, in their sight.

question: Which prophet was told not to mourn when his wife died?
explanation: Son of man, with one blow I am about to take away from you the delight of your eyes. Yet do not lament or weep or shed any tears.

verses.kjv: Son of man, behold, I take away from thee the desire of thine eyes with a stroke: yet neither shalt thou mourn nor weep, neither shall thy tears run down.

question: Which prophet walked around naked for three years as a sign?
explanation: Then the Lord said, 'Just as my servant Isaiah has gone stripped and barefoot for three years, as a sign and portent against Egypt and Cush.'

verses.kjv:
And the LORD said, Like as my servant Isaiah hath walked naked and barefoot three years
for a sign and wonder upon Egypt and upon Ethiopia;

question: Which prophet's name means 'Yahweh is God'?
explanation: Elijah's name in Hebrew means 'Yahweh is God,' reflecting his mission to turn Israel back to the true God.

verses.kjv:
And Elijah the Tishbite,
who was of the inhabitants of Gilead, said unto Ahab,
As the LORD God of Israel liveth, before whom I stand, there shall not be dew nor rain these years, but according to my word.

question: Which prophet was called while plowing with twelve yoke of oxen?
explanation: So Elijah went from there and found Elisha son of Shaphat. He was plowing with twelve yoke of oxen, and he himself was driving the twelfth pair.

verses.kjv:
So he departed thence, and found Elisha the son of Shaphat, who
was plowing
with twelve yoke
of oxen before him, and he with the twelfth: and Elijah passed by him, and cast his mantle upon him.

question: Which prophet was a shepherd from Tekoa?
explanation: The words of Amos, one of the shepherds of Tekoa.

verses.kjv: The words of Amos, who was among the herdmen of Tekoa, which he saw concerning Israel in the days of Uzziah king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash king of Israel, two years before the earthquake.

question: Which prophet was told to name his son 'Not my people'?
explanation: Then the Lord said, 'Call him Lo-Ammi (which means "not my people"), for you are not my people, and I am not your God.'

verses.kjv:
Then said
God, Call his name Lo-ammi: for ye
are
 not my people, and I will not be your
God.

question: Which prophet prophesied for exactly two years?
explanation: Haggai's ministry lasted from the second to the fourth year of King Darius, approximately two years.

verses.kjv: In the second year of Darius the king, in the sixth month, in the first day of the month, came the word of the LORD by Haggai the prophet unto Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and to Joshua the son of Josedech, the high priest, saying,

question: Which prophet has the shortest book in the Old Testament?
explanation: The book of Obadiah has only one chapter with 21 verses, making it the shortest book in the Old Testament.

verses.kjv: The vision of Obadiah. Thus saith the Lord GOD concerning Edom; We have heard a rumour from the LORD, and an ambassador is sent among the heathen, Arise ye, and let us rise up against her in battle.

question: Which prophet prophesied against Nineveh?
explanation: A prophecy concerning Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.

verses.kjv: The burden of Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.
